findings.metric: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome
findings.interpretation: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination was associated with a broader set of tumour proteins being represented in the immunopeptidome.

findings.metric: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome
findings.interpretation: The MHC-I-presented peptide landscape expanded in the condition described for mRNA vaccination, consistent with increased antigen presentation.

findings.comparator_or_baseline: Not applicable (p-value reported for vaccinated vs unvaccinated comparison)
findings.interpretation: In the retrospective metastatic cohort receiving ICI treatment, prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status was associated with improved survival (reported p=0.01).

findings.metric: Type I interferon response score (normalized units)
findings.interpretation: Tumours showed a marked induction of a type I interferon response after intratumoral mRNA vaccination according to the normalized score reported.

findings.metric: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue
findings.interpretation: PD-L1 expression increased in tumour tissue, potentially increasing the relevance of targeting the PD-L1 axis with checkpoint blockade.
The combination context reported increased CD8+ T-cell density in tumours, consistent with enhanced immune infiltration.

controls_or_null_results.statement: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.
ICI-only treatment had limited activity in low-immunogenic baseline settings.
Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
